title: Love Island's Molly-Mae opens up about her fellow Islanders in Text On The Beach
text:
From Cosmopolitan

It feels like forever since Love Island was taking over our lives. And we miss it, quite frankly.

So we’re glad we got the chance to catch up with Molly-Mae Hague recently. The 20-year-old played Text On The Beach with Cosmopolitan UK, and we learned all sorts of interesting things about her fellow Islanders.

Talking about who the hardest person to live with in the villa was, Molly-Mae said: “I mean there isn’t really anyone who stands out to me as being the hardest to live with. I think there were times when everyone got on each other’s nerves. I know I got on people’s nerves – I know I can be a little bit whingey and loud sometimes; I think everyone can. But I think, we all got on each other’s nerves at certain points because we were in that house for eight weeks."

Photo credit: Ricky Vigil M - Getty Images More

When she was asked what the hardest challenge had been for her in the villa, Molly-Mae said it was the ones to do with social media.

“I found it quite hard finding out what people were saying about you. When you have no idea what’s going on in the outside world, and to hear what people are saying about you that aren’t necessarily positive is a little bit hard."

She also opened up about the prospect of her and Tommy Fury's new house having a room dedicated to boxing memorabilia and Mayonnaise. Doesn't bear thinking about, does it?

Don't forget to check out Molly-Mae's Beauty Works collaboration.

description: Plus, what her flat with Tommy Fury is like
